item.title: Stelios in EasyJet board battle
item.description: Sir Stelios Haji-Ioannou, the flamboyant European entrepreneur, is seeking to wrest back influence over EasyJet amid a growing boardroom dispute at the low-cost airline

item.title: Clouds gather over Canary Wharf
item.description: Canary Wharf is facing the threat of rapidly emptying office blocks as big corporate tenants review their needs after the wave of bank mergers triggered by the financial crisis

item.title: Brown sets out anti-recession plan
item.description: Gordon Brown heralded an anti-recession strategy founded on tax cuts for low earners and further cuts in interest rates, in the hope that Britain will spend its way out of the downturn

item.title: Mandelson warns banks on lending curbs
item.description: Lord Mandelson issued a stern warning to banks against 'overreacting' to the prospect of businesses collapsing by withdrawing credit

item.title: Eurozone enters first recession
item.description: The eurozone fell into its first ever recession even before October's intensification of the global financial market crisis, official figures have shown, adding to fears that worse economic news is yet to come

item.title: Leaders temper G20 ambitions
item.description: World leaders played down expectations of dramatic breakthroughs at the start of this weekend's Group of 20 summit on the economic crisis, conceding that the political transition in the US made big decisions unlikely.

item.title: US retail executive urges action on spending
item.description: JC Penny chief executive called for government action to boost consumer spending as new figures showed a record fall in sales last month

item.title: Nokia braces for drop in phone sales
item.description: The handset maker predicted sales would fall next year in what would be only the second such decline in 15 years

item.title: Developers call halt to landmark offices
item.description: The list of landmark office building projects to be pulled amid weakening conditions across the London property market continues to rise

item.title: HBOS warns of nationalisation risk
item.description: HBOS issued a stark warning to investors that the bank could face the prospect of being nationalised if they vote against its takeover by Lloyds TSB

item.title: Clinton a contender for secretary of state
item.description: Hillary Clinton has emerged as a surprise contender to become secretary of state in Barack Obama's administration, months after the pair fought a bitter battle for the Democratic presidential nomination

item.title: Treasury to keep banks at arm's length
item.description: The state's £37bn stake in part-nationalised banks will be held at arm's length with no direct boardroom representation, say those charged with managing the investments

item.title: Collapse in demand may halt refinery construction as margins fall
item.description: Only 30 of the 160 refining projects announced since 2005, which should be completed in the next two to seven years, will now go ahead

item.title: Pandit purchases Citigroup shares
item.description: Citigroup moves to quash a boardroom revolt after some directors unhappy at the company's performance considered ousting Sir Win Bischoff as chairman.
